Material used.Material Name: Primary rat cortical neurons, Primary mouse mesencephalic neurons, PC12 cells
Material used.Description: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells were prepared from neonatal Wistar rats. Primary cultures of mesencephalic neurons were prepared from mouse embryos at embryonic day 15. The PC12 cell line was maintained in RPMI medium supplemented with 10% horse serum and 5% FBS.

Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of mutant A53T α-synuclein led to an increase in the number of EGFP-LC3 positive autophagosomes and enhanced LC3-I cleavage into LC3-II. It also increased the turnover of p62/SQSTM1.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were performed with multiple batches of neurons derived from different animals.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated multiple times with consistent results.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney or Student’s t test and one-way ANOVA, followed by a Newman-Keuls posthoc test or Kruskal-Wallis test, followed by a Dunn’s test.

Material used.Material Name: Primary rat cortical neurons, Primary mouse mesencephalic neurons, PC12 cells
Material used.Description: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells were prepared from neonatal Wistar rats. Primary cultures of mesencephalic neurons were prepared from mouse embryos at embryonic day 15. The PC12 cell line was maintained in RPMI medium supplemented with 10% horse serum and 5% FBS.

Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of mutant A53T α-synuclein enhanced LC3-I conversion into LC3-II and decreased the levels of p62.

Biological replicates.Description: All experiments were performed with multiple batches of neurons derived from different animals.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated multiple times with consistent results.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.
